abstract: A geometrical interpretation for the outer multiplicity rho that occurs in a reduction of the product of two SU(3) representations, (lambda(sub pi), mu(sub pi)) x (lambda(sub nu), mu(sub nu)) approaches sigma(sub rho)(lambda, mu)(sub rho), is introduced. This coupling of proton (pi) and neutron (nu) representations arises, for example, in both boson and fermion descriptions of heavy deformed nuclei. Attributing a geometry to the coupling raises the possibility of introducing a simple interaction that provides a physically meaningful way for distinguishing multiple occurrences of (lambda, mu) values that can arise in such products.
title: Geometrical interpretation for the outer SU(3) outer multiplicity label

publications.publicationName: NASA. Goddard Space Flight Center, Second International Workshop on Harmonic Oscillators

related.title: Addendum to the Proceedings of the Third International Mobile Satellite Conference (IMSC 1993)
